page.title: 08BELLINGTON PUMP HOUSE.
page.content: Almost 100% pure water is pumped from the bunter sandstone at a depth of 1,400 feet below the Kidderminster countryside.4 wells working 2 or 3 at a time provide 3 million gallons of { {water}a day for the East Worcestershire Water Company. Treatment is minimal;0.2% chlorine to purify the water in a contact tank holding 250,000 gallons.On returning a short distance to the pumping station it is treated with sulphur dioxide to remove the chlorine taste and then 5:1,000,000 parts of fluoride is added to safeguard consumers teeth. All pumping and purifying processes are carried out automatically, controlled by a large computer in Bromsgrove.This can be overridden for repairs.The company has 8 pumping stations & provides water to an area of 300 suare miles.
